column1: Last week I introduced the Building Rural Investments Development and Growth for the Economy (BRIDGE) Act a bipartisan bill with @RepCarolMiller from West Virginia that would help bridge the economic urban-rural divide as America continues to heal from COVID-19.

There will be serious consequences for first responders small businesses COVID testing capabilities and broadband access all of which could harm the health and economy of Western Marylanders for a long time to come without another relief bill.

I heard from Western Maryland leaders this week about how they are dealing with the worst spike in COVID-19 cases that we’ve ever seen since the start of this pandemic. Funds are running dry from the CARES money passed by Congress in March. https://t.co/A0EXHPVtSS

This #ChildHealthWeek we’re working to pave a new & better way forward for children everywhere. The #COVID19 pandemic threatens to erase the decades of progress we have made in global child health and survival. I'm working hard to make sure those gains are not lost.

The US has now surpassed 10 million confirmed cases of #COVID19. Too many Americans have lost loved ones and the number of deaths will continue to rise unless we take the immediate actions necessary to stop the spread. https://t.co/N3I25aKOWE

Maryland state health officials will open a free #COVID19 testing facility at the Allegany County Fairgrounds in the coming days. This is long overdue and great news for Western MD.  https://t.co/rk3Hr1HEiA

At my roundtable with Councilmember @willjawando we discussed how #COVID19 has impacted the mental health of our students. Check out the full replay of this incredibly important conversation: https://t.co/95qCH2YxTx

In Frederick yesterday I met with Mayor Michael O'Connor and representatives from @FredCityGovt @DwntwnFrederick @FredArtsCouncil & @CivilWarMed to discuss how we can best help Frederick small businesses and arts organizations recover from #COVID19. Thanks for having me! https://t.co/DxLVWgOMpL

That's why the Maryland Delegation has come together to ask Gov. Hogan to increase the state’s focus on stopping the disproportionate spread of #COVID19 among MD’s Latinx communities & delivering targeted relief to Latinx families.   https://t.co/GYyD9wIJHo https://t.co/NhLfQq4GRn

The #COVID19 pandemic has only worsened the opioid epidemic. These concurrent public health crises must be addressed by the next administration or else we are setting ourselves up for catastrophe.   https://t.co/ohsl5yoZpO

Washington County has added another free #COVID19 testing site in Hagerstown. Remember: wear a mask wash your hands and get tested. It takes all of us to stop the spread of the coronavirus.  https://t.co/k0H39BFWgs

On #WorldFoodDay I stand with @FAONorthAmerica & our partners around the globe working to end chronic hunger. #COVID19 has caused food insecurity to skyrocket. That's why I'm working with my colleagues to ensure no one goes hungry during this pandemic.

We need a coordinated global effort to ensure that any #COVID19 vaccine is accessible to everyone. That’s exactly what @RepBrianFitz @RepHoulahan @RepTedYoho and I are asking VP Pence to do.  https://t.co/MOT3Caoqeg https://t.co/rafFjsinQJ

Today DC reported its highest single-day #COVID19 case increase since early June. This is no time to disregard the seriousness of this crisis.  As Members of the National Capital Region Delegation we are calling for immediate action to control the White House outbreak. https://t.co/n2nCcBhGLb
Maryland Residents: Find your nearest COVID-19 testing site and most up to date information by visiting https://t.co/tmwQncAy1K.
A new study from @JECDems reveals that the Latinx community is about 3x more likely to test positive for #COVID19 and 5x more likely to be hospitalized.   https://t.co/V1qaY1y3Wq

At my roundtable yesterday we heard from community leaders & elected officials about the steps the federal government can take to support the Latinx community which has been hit especially hard by the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/0cU8aWGe6G

June and I send our prayers to President Trump and his wife for a speedy recovery.   It takes all of us to stop the spread of #COVID19. Please remember to wear a mask social distance and get tested if you have symptoms.
UPDATE: The Washington County Health Department has added more free walk-up #COVID19 testing dates.   Details: https://t.co/We9aTnDmA9

The #COVID19 pandemic has caused levels of depression and anxiety to skyrocket. That's why I have called for the highest possible levels of funding for addiction and mental health support services in any future relief packages.   https://t.co/F7mIQ2rj79

That's why I helped introduce legislation to provide a $17.9B investment in low-income & minority communities that have been hit especially hard by #COVID19. We have a lot of work to do to correct the decades of systemic racism built into our economy.   https://t.co/bT5O2uod2T

Even as #COVID19 cases are on the rise & millions have lost their jobs President Trump has nominated a judge who would destroy the Affordable Care Act & cause millions to lose their health care. Let me be clear: there should be no confirmation until a new president is sworn in.

Maryland has seen an alarming spike in overdose deaths due to #COVID19. I'm calling on House Leadership to prioritize legislation to help end the addiction crisis.  Read my full statement: https://t.co/ZfAJyrjGEX https://t.co/6OTPrEP7jt

Thank you to everyone who joined my webinar on Recovery in the Time of COVID-19. We had a great conversation about what we can do to support our family and friends who may be struggling with substance use disorders amid the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/t441GyspDR

TOMORROW: I'll be joined by special guests @RepDaveJoyce @RepJohnJoyce and @RepLoriTrahan  for a discussion about recovery in the time of #COVID19. Don't miss out!   Register now: https://t.co/6fkz3imUi8 https://t.co/JMzFkRDsXz

The #COVID19 pandemic has only exacerbated the addiction crisis in our country. If we don't act fast we risk losing the incredible progress we've made in recent years. The next relief package MUST include funding to address this frightening trend.   https://t.co/VvIF9ZtGH5
President Trump deliberately lied about the threat of #COVID19 and we lost over 200000 American lives as a result. It didn’t have to be this way.  https://t.co/UvXydnkYwn
YOU'RE INVITED: Register now for my Recovery in the Time of COVID-19 webinar with special guests @RepDaveJoyce @RepJohnJoyce and @RepLoriTrahan! https://t.co/6fkz3imUi8

Have you heard? I'm hosting a webinar on Thursday at 1pm with @RepDaveJoyce @RepJohnJoyce and @RepLoriTrahan about how we can support our family and friends in recovery amid the #COVID19 pandemic. Join us! https://t.co/6fkz3imUi8

The #COVID19 pandemic is costing MD nearly $33 million in additional annual childcare costs. That's why I am a proud cosponsor of @rosadelauro's bill to provide $50 billion to stabilize the childcare sector. Time for @senatemajldr to bring this bill to a vote in the Senate.
Recovery is hard. #COVID19 is making it even harder. #RecoveryMonth is more important this year than ever. https://t.co/nbjeQeu7ML

The COVID-19 pandemic has made recovery that much harder for those suffering from addiction. Last week I toured addiction treatment centers in Western Maryland to speak to patients and hear how they’re managing during this pandemic. https://t.co/aBj0mNCQwf

Today marks the beginning of Hispanic Heritage Month. What should be a festive celebration looks different this year: the Latinx community has been disproportionately hit by the #COVID19 pandemic. This #HHM we can't just celebrate - we need to act. https://t.co/QYZVRyBThf
The Washington County Health Department has added more free #COVID19 testing sites and times. If you feel sick stay home wear a mask and get tested. https://t.co/TWvd0DLIPV
I applaud the work of my House colleagues. We deserve to know the truth about the impact of #COVID19. Instead the Trump Administration is playing politics with American lives. https://t.co/Jfs4rrogRt

We now know what we long suspected: the President deliberately lied about the threat of the coronavirus and left our country unprepared to deal with the biggest public health threat we've seen in a generation. https://t.co/QnRz8c4HUo

Addiction touches every community in America and the COVID-19 pandemic has made this crisis even worse. Yesterday in honor of National Recovery Month I visited addiction treatment centers across the Sixth District to hear how this pandemic has impacted those in recovery.

The COVID-19 pandemic has presented some serious challenges to those in recovery. This month we're coming together across party lines and from every corner of this country to elevate the voices of people who are fighting this horrible disease.  https://t.co/KYDOJNhdtj

We’re dealing with an addiction crisis that is only getting worse due to COVID-19 and we need to make sure that everyone has access to the help that they need to recover from this disease. This school will help these students remain in recovery and create a better future.
